item.title: Wccftech Awards ’25 – Best Games of 2025 and Most Anticipated of 2026 from Staff and Community
item.content:encoded:
Following the conclusion of the staff and community polls, it is time to declare the winners of the Wccftech Awards '25, which include the best games of 2025 and most anticipated titles of 2026, based on the nominees from our genre lists.

Let's begin with the results of our best games of 2025 polls. When it comes to last year's releases, the Wccftech staff and our community agreed on practically every winner except for a single category, Strategy and Simulation, with our staff giving the award to Square Enix's Final Fantasy Tactics - Ivalice Chronicles, while our community preferred Slipgate's Tempest Rising.

The clear winner is, to the surprise of absolutely nobody at this point, Sandfall's Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, which walks away with four prizes: best indie game and Game of the Year from both staff and community.

The universally acclaimed game did, however, lose to Warhorse's Kingdom Come: Deliverance II in the best RPG category. Other multi-winners in the Wccftech Awards '25 include Sucker Punch's Ghost of Yotei in the action category, Team Cherry's Hollow Knight: Silksong in the platform category, Nintendo's Mario Kart World in the sports/racing category, AdHoc Studio's Dispatch in the adventure category, EA's Battlefield 6 in the shooter category, KONAMI's Silent Hill f in the horror category, KOF Studio's Fatal Fury: City of Wolves in the fighting category, Embark's ARC Raiders in the multiplayer category, and NEOWIZ's Lies of P: Overture in the DLC/expansion category.

When it comes to the Wccftech staff and community 2026 polls, they were a fair bit more discordant than the 2025 polls, but that is to be expected given that we're talking about unreleased games. Our own staff also voted differently in a few categories, resulting in a few ties at the top.

Even so, one game emerged above all the others. Yes, it's obviously Rockstar's Grand Theft Auto 6, which received four prizes: most anticipated action game from the community, most anticipated multiplayer from the community, and most anticipated overall from both staff (tied) and community. The runner-up for most anticipated prizes is CAPCOM's Resident Evil Requiem, which got three: most anticipated horror game from both staff and community, and most anticipated overall from the staff (tied).

item.title: Wizards of the Coast is “Bringing the Spirit of D&D Homebrew to Fortnite,” New D&D Fortnite Islands Announced
item.content:encoded:
The latest Fortnite collab has been revealed, and it's seemingly just in time to catch Stranger Things fans who are looking for anything that makes them feel closer to their favourite show now that it's over. Wizards of the Coast has announced five new Fortnite Islands, all Dungeons & Dragons inspired, officially bringing D&D to the popular everything game.

The five islands were made through a collaboration with UEFN creators Chartis Games and Teravision Games, each of them "inspired by iconic D&D locations, monsters, and gameplay styles ranging from PvP and platforming to a massive co-op roguelike experience," according to a press release.

"We’re bringing the spirit of D&D homebrew to Fortnite," added Nick Strann, franchise strategy director for Dungeons & Dragons at Wizards of the Coast. "Supporting creators, experimenting in new mediums, and learning how we can introduce D&D to new players. D&D already means so much to all those who have joined us at the table, and we hope that we can make it just as meaningful for millions of Fortnite fans. We very much look forward to hearing player feedback on these creator-made islands and using that feedback to shape future adventures wherever people love D&D."

Here are the five islands and their island codes:

  • DnD Boxfights – Island Code 1190-4691-0255 
  • DnD Treasure RNG – Island Code 4958-2624-5634 
  • DnD Dungeon Deathrun – Island Code 5806-6430-0158 
  • DnD Bossfight – Island Code 2218-1049-5866 
  • DnD Zombie Dragon Adventure (early access) – Island Code 2525-9596-3235 

Last year, Fortnite had more than a few major collaborations that saw the game go through major environmental changes for a limited time, most notably with its collaborations around The Simpsons, the Walt Disney World theme parks, and the Quentin Tarantino collaboration.

The official introduction of D&D to Fortnite doesn't seem to be on the same scale as any of those past collabs, but that's likely due to Wizards of the Coast claiming these islands are part of a "launch and learn initiative to explore how D&D can connect with a diverse range of Fortnite players in fun and meaningful ways."

We know how far Fortnite collaborations can go, and how expansive the world of D&D is. If Wizards of the Coast feels good about how the launch of these five islands is received, we may be in for a much grander D&D collaboration with Fortnite in the future.

item.title: Life is Strange: Reunion, an ‘Emotional Conclusion to Max & Chloe’s Journey’, Launches on March 26
item.content:encoded:
As promised last week, Deck Nine Games has just announced Life is Strange: Reunion, a new entry in the adventure game series published by Square Enix.

The press release describes this as the emotional conclusion to the journey of Max and Chloe, the main characters in the acclaimed first game of the saga. For story reasons we won't spoil here, fans would never have thought the two could meet again, and yet they will in this new title.

Players will once again visit the grounds of Caledon University, where Max Caulfield works as a photography teacher, as seen in 2024's game Life is Strange: Double Exposure. Returning from a weekend away, Max finds her beloved Caledon ablaze, as a raging inferno destroys the campus and ends the lives of Max's friends, students, and faculty alike. She escapes the devastation only because of her Rewind power. After jumping back in time through a selfie, Max now has just three days to work out how the fire began and prevent it.

That's when Chloe Price arrives at Caledon, much to Max's surprise. This is apparently a shocking repercussion of Max's merging of the timelines that happened at the end of Double Exposure. Haunted by nightmares of a past she never lived, and with her grip on reality quickly unraveling, Chloe needs Max's help more than ever.

The standout feature is that, for the first time in the series, Life is Strange: Reunion lets players play as both Max and Chloe in the same game, alternating between their perspectives as the story unfolds. Max's Rewind power is, of course, used to undo and redo decisions, change the course of conversations, and manipulate the environment to solve '4D puzzles', while Chloe's Backtalk ability, quick wits, and attitude let her sway key suspects and go where Max cannot.

Deck Nine Games aims to build on the series' grounded storytelling to provide players with meaningful choices that affect the outcome of a dramatic and surprising narrative, all culminating in an epic climax that serves as a finale to the Max and Chloe saga.

Life is Strange: Reunion is now available for pre-order on PC (Steam and Microsoft Store), PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series S|X. The Standard Edition is priced at $39.99, but there are also more expensive editions that include other perks and bonuses, such as the Deluxe Edition ($49.99), which comes with the following:

  • Full Game
  • Digital Mini Soundtrack
  • Digital Art Book
  • Digital Comic
  • Exclusive Behind-the-Scenes Documentary with actors Hannah Telle (Max) and Rhianna DeVries (Chloe)

Then there's the Twin Pack edition, which gives you access to the last two games in the series (both in their Standard Editions) and costs $59.99. Finally, the Collector's Edition is priced at $99.99 and includes:

  • Full Game
  • COLLECTOR'S GOODS BOX AND SLEEVE with exclusive artwork by ILYA KUVSHINOV
  • 12” Vinyl Soundtrack featuring 12 songs from the game on an orange 12” EcoRecord vinyl
  • Double-Sided DRUGSTORE MAKEUP 24” x 12” Poster
  • Rewind Symbol Felt Slipmat
  • 3x Custom Double-Sided Guitar Plectrums with six unique designs
  • 3x Polaroid Art Cards celebrating Max and Chloe

The Life is Strange: Reunion Collector's Edition is only available for purchase through the official Square Enix Store. North American players have the exclusive option to purchase a Collector's Edition that does not include the actual game.
